abstract.p: Museum of the City of New York vice president Barbara Livenstein letter on May 27 article on museum's photo exhibitions

block.p: We were thrilled to see your coverage of two books of photographs -- ''New York Rises'' and ''A Living Lens'' -- that are related to exhibitions on view at the Museum of the City of New York, although your article (''The City, Framed: Jewish Life, Soaring Bridges, Fulton Market,'' Reading New York, May 27) mentioned only one of the companion exhibitions.

We were thrilled to see your coverage of two books of photographs -- ''New York Rises'' and ''A Living Lens'' -- that are related to exhibitions on view at the Museum of the City of New York, although your article (''The City, Framed: Jewish Life, Soaring Bridges, Fulton Market,'' Reading New York, May 27) mentioned only one of the companion exhibitions.

Your readers may be interested in knowing that there is also an exhibition on view at the museum that is a partner with Alana Newhouse's book, ''A Living Lens.'' The title of that exhibition is ''The Jewish Daily Forward: Embracing an Immigrant Community.''
The writer is vice president for communications, Museum of the City of New York.
